title: Lewis Hamilton at Emporio Armani show during MFW
text:
He never fails to dress to impress in a style-savvy look.
And Lewis Hamilton naturally donned his glad rags when he attended Milan Fashion Week, descending upon the Emporio Armani show on Friday morning in a fashion forward ensemble.
The Formula One pro certainly stood out from the crowd in a bright red coat teamed with a matching fitted top.
Scroll down for video
Racing ahead in the style stakes: Lewis Hamilton donned his glad rags when he attended Milan Fashion Week, descending upon the Emporio Armani show on Friday morning in a fashion forward ensemble
Lewis upped his sartorial game by accessorising with a coordinating camouflage print scarf in shades of red and grey.
He kept his look casual thanks to a pair of skinny jeans and a funky pair of patterned trainers.
Nicole Scherzinger's ex sported a pair of trendy, retro spectacles, cutting a debonair figure as he arrived at the show.
Red alert: The Formula One pro certainly stood out from the crowd in a bright red coat
Stylish: Lewis upped his sartorial game by accessorising with a coordinating camouflage print scarf in shades of red and grey
Social media savvy: Lewis ensured to document the fun occassion
People pleaser: The star also took time to mingle with fans
What shall I get? He was spoilt for choice inside the store
Famous friends: Lewis joined Naomi Campbell in the front row for the Versace show
Let me take a selfie: The pair watched the show during Milan Fashion Week Fall/Winter 2017/18
Army chic: Lewis wouldn't have looked amiss on the runway himself, in his intricate khaki tones
Blue and green should never be seen: The pair went for a bold look for their appearance at the show
Glamorous: Lewis was joined by a host of Italian fashionistas, including actress Valeria Solarino
Stunning: Leading ladies Elisabetta Pellini (left) and Margareth Made (right) were dressed to impress
Looking good: Tina Kunakey, who is Vincent Cassel's girlfriend, stood out from the crowd in a smart cropped jacket and funky shoes
The Emporio Armani presentation was attended by a host of Italian stars, bringing together the fashion elite.
Meanwhile, Lewis recently insisted he had no problems with Mercedes or his new teammate Valtteri Bottas.
The 32-year-old star had hit the headlines when he criticised the fact teammates can look at each other's data after practice sessions.
Khaki perfection: Fiammetta Cicogna embraced a head-to-toe khaki look included flared trousers and a silk jacket
Armani ambassadors: Candela Novembre (L) and Gala Gonzalez (R) were flying the flag for the brand in their new season print
Red hot: Nozomi Sasaki gave her ladylike dress a tomboy twist thanks to a leather jacket
Backstage beauties: Models posed together as they prepared for the show to start
Business chic: Red was a standout colour on the runway for Armani this season
Taking to social media to clear up the backlash caused by his comments, Lewis shared: 'I wish to clarify, I have not hit out at my team at all. My point on data sharing is solely my feelings about the sport in general.
'It has been my feeling since the day I started F1 and still is 10 years later. There is zero problems in my team, zero problems with Bottas.
'Whatever happens, TeamLH we got this!'
Check them out: Models strutted down the catwalk in checked coats with bow detailing
Sports luxe: Sportswear was given a high fashion twist thanks to oversized silhouettes
Power dressing: Blazers and knotted scarves were rife on the Milan catwalk
Specs appeal: 0ne model's quirky shades matched her intricate embroidered shirt
